definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Yes, till modern history, modern vernacular Chinese is popular.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，到了近现代就是白话文了。

sentences.english: These theories proposed for the emergence of the vernacular to provide guidance.
sentences.chinese: 这些理论的提出为白话文的出现提供了指导。

sentences.english: The principal of Jinan First Normal School was a New side figure who first adopted schoolbook written in the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 一师校长是新派人物，首先采用了白话文教科书。

sentences.english: Tom: Yes, till modern history, modern vernacular Chinese is popular.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，到了近现代就是白话文了。

sentences.english: The new style and opened the gates of the late Qing dynasty the vernacular boom.
sentences.chinese: 新文体打开了晚清白话文热潮的闸门。

sentences.english: Pai-hua made literature more accessible to China's working class.
sentences.chinese: 白话文更接近中国的工人阶级。

sentences.english: Paraphrase the ancient Chinese prose in colloquialism language.
sentences.chinese: 把这篇古文译成白话文。

sentences.english: The Journal The New Youth was the main battlefield of the vernacular literature movement.
sentences.chinese: 《新青年》是“白话文学运动”的主要阵地。

definition: old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
novel in chapters, main format for long novels from the Ming onwards, with each chapter headed by a summary couplet
old form of writing/piece in the old style
old verse/poetry in the old style
eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
